div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: VISION: People are drawn to Higbee R-VIII for academic excellence.
MISSION: Every child has potential, and it is our mission to help each child reach their potential to be hard-working, well-rounded, life-long learners.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h1.div: School Building Closed Due to COVID-19

div.p: Our regular board meeting on April 9 at 6:00 p.m. will be held via Google Hangouts due to the stay at home order and ensuring social distancing.

Updated (3/25/2020): Randolph County Health Department has issued a stay at home order until April 24th, 2020, so Higbee R-VIII will be closed until then. We will continue to monitor and update as the situation changes.

Starting next week, we will change the way we are distributing food. We will prepare breakfast and lunch meals for Tuesday-Friday and distribute them all on Tuesday's. There will be freezer packs, refrigerator packs, and counter top packs. There will be directions for heating and serving certain items included. Weekly buddy packs for eligible students will also be distributed at that time. We will hand these out between 11 a.m. and noon on Tuesday's and there will be no other distributions for the week. This way, you will not have to come every day to pick up.
If you are unable to pick up on Tuesday's at the scheduled time, please contact us and let us know. We will make other arrangements for you if necessary.

Any family with children 18 years old or younger in Higbee R-VIII School District can get these meals if you need them. However, you will need to contact us by Friday for us to have them prepared by Tuesday. Since the offices will be closed next week and we will only be checking voicemails as possible, you may leave a phone message if you aren't in a hurry. However, if you email or message us through Facebook we will check those regularly and be able to respond faster.
Please continue to stay safe and stay home. If you need anything, contact us as soon as possible.

Updated (3/24/2020): We received word that the first case of COVID-19 in Randolph County has been diagnosed and all schools will probably be required to extend closures. At this time, we are waiting to hear more before making a decision as to how long. Your teachers are trying to make contact with you (if you haven't been contacting them) to find out how you are and if you need help with anything (assignments, food, etc.). If you haven't heard from your teacher or made contact with them, please do so by any means possible with the exception of in person (keep that social distancing happening).

We will feed all children ages 18 and under if you need it (just please let us know ahead of time so we have enough), and also let us know if you don't want them if you have been getting them. Pickup times are 11 a.m.- Noon, Tuesday-Friday in front of the building. If you live out of town or are sick and can't pick up, please contact us. We will figure out a way to feed you.

If you need anything from the school, please call or email us. We are only manning the front office from 9 a.m.-1 p.m. this week, but will check voicemail as often as possible. The best way to contact us is through email since most of us are still checking emails constantly and responding as quickly as possible. You can find our faculty and staff emails here.

Nobody (including non-essential staff) will be allowed in the building after Friday, March 27, 2020, to ensure the health and safety of the food staff so we can continue to feed our students. If you need something from the building, please make arrangements between now and Friday with a staff member to get it taken care of.
We will keep you posted as we know more. Stay safe and stay home!

h3.div: Visit our Resources for Parents page for resources regarding the Coronavirus that parents can use to talk to their child(ren) along with activities that will help reduce worry and promote family discussions and routines during this break.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: Hello and thank you for visiting our school website.

h3.div: We hope to make this website as functional as possible. This page will serve as an on-going newsletter with information about what is happening in our school, and important news from faculty. Please be sure to check back often and see what has been happening in the district!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h1.div: Sign up for our newsletter Tiger Pride >>>>>>>>

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-Clt0zb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Congratulations to our students that placed at the CCAA Math Contest,
held at Calvary Lutheran in Jefferson City.

p.strong: Overall: Tied for Second Place in the Jr. High Team Competition

div.p: Hannah Fortier 3rd Place Raegan Derboven 5th Place
Alie Mitchell 1st Place Will Spilman 3rd Place
Jaxon Hudson 4th Place Christian Chester 5th Place

p.strong: Jr. High Team Computation 1st Place members of the team:
Raegan Derboven, Hannah Fortier, Christian Chester, and Alie Mitchell.

div.p: Steven Johnson 2nd Place
Emma Johnson 5th Place Colby Mitchell 6th Place
Julie Johnson 3rd Place

p.strong: High School Computation 4th Place members of the team: Colby Mitchell, Jamie Smith, and Julie Johnson

h3.div: Congratulations to our CCAA Art Show winners
